ovdesc.p: Holds the instance of the SY.PRODUCT.DEFINTION. This is the Structured Product which is being traded.

If the TRACKING field is set to 'No', this record will be defaulted from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION as at the time of committing this record. This record will then contain the data relating to processing of this product.
If the TRACKING field is set to 'No', the data relating to processing of this product is taken from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION.

desc.p: This is a valid SY.UNIT.DEFINITION record which forms a part of the SY.UNIT ID. This unit will have the corresponding operation applied when the associated EVENT occurs.
Can contain a valid SY.UNIT.DEFINITION record.
Short name for the product - defaulted from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION.
Free text field up to 35 characters.
If populated this will be the valuation routine that will be used to valuate this structured product.
Valuation routine must have an associated PGM.FILE record.
This is a system generated field only and is non-inputtable.
This field is used internally by T24 to monitor the status of the tracking fields on the application.
The last date on which a deal for this product may be accepted into the system.
This field can be used to specify any delivery message(s) to be invoked for this event.
This must be a valid record in EB.ACTIVITY.

When Tracking is enabled the instantiated Product will track any changes made to the Product Definition during the product lifecycle. Otherwise the instantiated Product will copy the state of the Product definition when created.
Therefore, if TRACKING is set, the tracked fields will be cleared
Can be set to either YES or NO.
This field is set to YES if the Product is published in the AA catalog or to NO if it has been removed from the AA catalog.
System generated field - defaulted from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION.
This field holds a generic category id which degfines the category of the product. This information is defaulted from the SY.PARAMETER record.
When YES this indicates that the Account Sweeping Process should automatically sweep transactions from the customers segregated account to the customers source account.
When the appropriate SY.PARAMETER record has its SWEEP.ACCT.MASTER field set to 'Off' then this field will be ignored and no sweeping will occur.
Can be YES or NO (or blank if TRACKING is set to YES)
A currency which defines the product. Such as "USD".
This is the operation that will be applied to the corresponding SY.UNIT (as defined by the corresponding UNIT.DEF and INSTANCE) when the associated EVENT occurs.
Must contain one of the values 'New', 'Input', 'Reverse', 'Authorise', 'Delete', 'Verify' or 'Run'.
A list of Transaction codes that are to be automatically swept by the Account Sweeping process or the single value 'All' which indicates that all accounting entries are to be swept.
Can contain either TRANSACTION keys or a single value 'ALL' (or blank if TRACKING is set to YES or SWEEP.ACCT is set to NO).
It is a noinput field at this level it is defaulted from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION
This field contains the overrides generated by the system against this record.
System Generated field only - non-inputtable.
Indicates whether the product has reached the end of it's lifecycle yet - set to 'Yes' when this has happened.
System Generated field only - non-inputtable.
The key to the product interface record which exposes an underlying application to the framework and will result in the processing of this product.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
This is a list of Events that can occur in the product lifecycle.
All Activities (An Activity = Operation + Unit + optionally Instance ) under a single event will occur in a single transaction bound.
Can contain valid SY.EVENT.DEFINITION keys.
Key for this SY.PRODUCT record.
Key is composed of two parts, the SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION key followed by the SY.TRANSACTION key.
Description of the product - defaulted from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION
Free text up to 50 characters.
Product Definition key (for SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION), defaulted from the record key.
System Generated field only - non-inputtable.
This must be empty when the corresponding action is new because a new unit will take the nex incremental instance.
Otherwise this must be either a quoted literal instance ID e.g. "0001" or a virtual field which equates to the number of an instance.
This field sets the default value for inclusion/exclusion of SY underlying deals in the valuation and customer position reporting.
If set to "YES" this will only report the SY deal otherwise all transactions created by the SY product along with the SY deal will be displayed.
Transaction key (for SY.TRANSACTION), defaulted from the record key.
System Generated field only - non-inputtable.
This is the Sub-Asset Type for this product.
This will be defaulted from SY.PARAMETER
Must be a valid SUB.ASSET.TYPE.
The first date on which a deal for this product may be accepted into the system.
This specifies whether this event is active or not.
An attempt to process an Event that is not active will raise an error.
Must be either YES or NO.
When YES this indicates that the Product is complete and can be dealt on.
Deals cannot be created for a Product which is not complete.
This is a list of Dependent Events that must have occurred previously in this product's lifecycle in order for this event to occur.
Attempting to process an Event that has not had all its dependencies satisfied will raise an error.
Can contain valid SY.EVENT.DEFINITION.RECORDS.
Defines whether a deposit will be taken from the client at inception of this deal.
This field will hold the date on which the contract was terminated.
